article.headline: Bucknell 62, Stephen F. Austin 49
article.story: AMES, Iowa (AP) -- Chris McNaughton scored 16 points and John Griffin hit a key 3-pointer late in the game to help secure Bucknell's 62-49 over Stephen F. Austin in the first round of the Cyclone Challenge on Friday night. Kevin Bettencourt added 12 points on four 3-point baskets for Bucknell (3-2), while Charles Lee contributed 11 points and five assists. Stephen F. Austin (1-2), which had been averaging 90.5 points a game, trailed 38-22 at halftime and got the lead below double figures only once in the second half. Josh Porter led the Lumberjacks with 17 points. No one else scored more than eight. Porter's jumper cut the lead to 49-39 with 9:05 remaining and a minute later, he stole the ball near midcourt and took it in for a two-handed dunk, drawing the Lumberjacks to 49-41. But they went the next 4 1/2 minutes without scoring and Bucknell pulled away. Griffin's 3-pointer made it 56-41 with 4:45 to play and McNaughton followed with two free throws. Stephen F. Austin was never closer than 11 after that.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
